0.Pros: Co-workers, free meals, keeps you busy

1.Pros: good benefits, good networking in other countries than USA
1.Cons: high hierarch, too many layers to make decisions, the customer suffer because wait too long for the benefit of the change.You have no voice if you have no power. No innovation

2.Pros: Exciting new change from being a general manager in retail to working in fast food. I loved getting people to smile everyday.
2.Cons: Under staffed and too many call outs do to lack of loyalty with in the restaurant. And zero appreciation for the extra things you do

3.Pros: Easy workgood experiencemake good friendsgood hours
3.Cons: Stuck at 7.25 in most locationshard to be promoted

4.Pros: It doesn't take long to move up from crew member to crew trainer to make more money. Fun environment to work in when you have a cool crew.
4.Cons: Its very fast paced environment almost constantly. This job isn't for you if you are to sensitive and get your feelings hurt easily because some of the customers can be really rude for no reason. No matter if you are given a raise or not you will never be paid for all the work it takes to run the restaurant.

5.Pros: free meals, basic skills, decent hours
5.Cons: unprofessional management, rude customers, unhealthy environment

6.Pros: You get good solid work experience and learn how to work with people and how to work productively under pressure.
6.Cons: I got injured with a faulty fryer and they barely covered my treatment, and expected me back at work the next day.

7.Pros: great place to work. great people. great food.

8.Pros: Friendly work environment, good manager, easy to keep pace in

9.Pros: Structured in a black and white manner you know what to expect each day pretty much. same ol.
